exhibition_title: Silk and More: Central Asian Textiles
exhibition_description:
The merchants of Central Asia have long been famous for the luxury goods they transported on the famous Silk Road. Less well known are the stunning textiles they created for their own use, from interiors fabrics and apparel to dowry treasures and items defining social and cultural identity.
This exhibition celebrates the complexity and diversity of Central Asiaâ€™s rich aesthetic textile heritage, from the complex silk ikats and elaborate suzani embroidery of urban areas to tent bands and felts created in the nomadic tradition. From Afghanistan to Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan to Turkmenistan work of individual artists have helped to maintain cultural traditions for millennia, whereas the interdependence of highly skilled urban artists of the Central Asian Khanates often reflect influences from the many foreign interactions that were an integral essence of the Silk Road. This installation will not include the art of the rug maker, who justifiably receives considerable exposure, but instead will highlight the art of the dyer and embroider.
